result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R Logterman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:42 AM 21CF102/22CF13 - Defendant Jacob R Logterman in court.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jacob R Logterman.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Court is provided with the plea questionnaire and indicates that a plea will be entered on count 1; 21CF102 and Count 1; 22CF13. Court goes over the plea questionnaire an court colloquy. Defendant enters a plea of NC. Court enters the plea and finds him guilty. State moves to dismiss and read in all other counts. So ordered. Attorney Harper states the joint agreement and ask for expungement in count 1; 21CF102 upon completion of probation. 

22CF13; count 1:

Court withholds sentence and orders probation for 3 years. (concurrent)

Conditions:

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any treatment or programming ordered by the agent.
Obey all rules and regulations of the department.
Pay costs, fees, and any surcharges.
0 days credit in the event of revocation.
Submit DNA sample at the Richland County Sheriff's Department.
Sign up for probation today


2021CF102; count 1 
Court orders a time served sentenced. 146 days credit.
Expungement  is granted upon completion of  probation

Pursuant to sec. 973.015 Wisconsin Statutes, upon successful completion of probation, Defendant is eligible for expungement of this record and should follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure. 

All other counts DRI.

Firearms warning are given by the court to the defendant.
Jury selection on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury selection on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial on June 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:09 AM Defendant Jacob R Logterman in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Walter Frank in court for Jacob R Logterman.  Attorney Jennifer M. Harper in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Frank state that these cases are not resolved and asks for a jury scheduling. Court set jury trail the week of June 27th, Jury selection would be June 27 at 9 am along with the final pretrial status on June 20 at 10 AM. Jury verdict forms, discovery form need to be completed by June 20 at 10 AM. June 28th jury trial date doesn't work for Attorney Frank. Court notes that the 28th doesn't work for counsel.
Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

02:07 PM 21CF102/22CF13 - Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video means for Defendant Jacob R Logterman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob R Logterman appeared by video means in ther Richland County Jail. Attorney Frank has receieved the complaint in 22CF13 and waives the time limits and waives his right to a preliminary hearing. Court binds over for trial. State and defense are willing to go forward with instant arraignment. Max penalties stated. Attorney Frank enters NG plea  Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:01 AM 21CF102/Unfiled Case Attorney Mark Walter Frank appeared by video means for Defendant Jacob R Logterman. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jacob R Logterman appeared by video means in the Richland County Jail. Attorney Frank has spoke with his client about the waiver of rights to a preliminary hearing in 21CF102. JL concurs. Court binds him over to trail. Attorney Harper  has just submitted the information. Attorney Frank is prepared with moving forward with the arraignment since the state is bring forth that same charges. Attorney Frank stands mute. Max penalties stated.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

01:29 PM by Zoom. Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by video means for Defendant Jacob R Logterman. Attorney Jennifer M. Harper appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. 21CF102 called, along with this yet-unfiled matter. Def is in the Richland County Jail. Atty. Angel notes that Def will have a different public defender for the next hearing. Matters reset to 2/10 at 10 for initial appearance in the unfiled matter and prelim in 21CF102.
No contact with the Richland Center Mobil Mart.

10:13 a.m. by Zoom. DA Harper appeared for the State. Def appeared, without counsel, in custody, from the Richland County Jail. State asks for $5k cash bond plus no contact with Mobil Mart. Def addresses the Court; can't post. Court orders 5k cash plus no contact as requested. 1/28 at 11 for initial. Def to call SPD.

(After the hearing, DA's office notes to clerk that the Def has another matter set for 1/28 at 1:00 and requests that this new, unfiled matter be set for the same time. Clerk will prepare the bond with an initial appearance time of 1 p.m.)
